subject: English
title: Chapter 28 The Elf Singing
content:
--- Page 1 ---
ceceeceeceeeees 28. The Elf Singing cece ec ceeceenceesceesceeeceeeceees

An Elf sat on a twig.

He was not very big.

He sang a little song,

He did not think it wrong;

But he was on a Wizard’s ground,
Who hated all sweet sound.

ns .
KNP2H?

Elf, Elf,

Take care of yourself,
He’s coming behind you,
To seize you and bind you
And stifle your song.

The Wizard ! the Wizard !
He changes his shape

In crawling along.

An ugly old ape,

A poisonous lizard,

A spotted spider,
A wormy glider,
The Wizard ! the Wizard !
He’s up on the bough;

He’ll bite through your gizzard.
He’s close to you now !

u

6

J] REP +


--- Page 2 ---
The Elf went on with his song.
It grew more clear and strong.
It lifted him into air.

He floated singing away,
With rainbows in his hair;

While the Wizard-worm from his creep
Made a sudden leap,

Fell down into a hole,

And, ere his magic word he could say,

Was eaten up by a Mole.
— William Allingham

POPPE ESO E EEE HELE EEE HOLE EEE OOOOH EE EEE HELE EEE EOE EEEESEEEEEEELOEHEEHEEEEE EEO LEE EEE SELES ELEEE ESE LEEELELELELELELEELS

e elf : an imaginary creature with magical powers. e twig : a small thin stem
of wood that grows from a branch on a tree. e seize : take hold of somebody or
something. e stifle : stop something from happening. e bough: a main branch
onatree. e gizzard : a part of (a bird’s) stomach. e ere: before. e mole: a
small dark furry animal.

1. Read the poem aloud.
2. Write the pairs of rhyming words you find in this poem.
3. Complete the following in your own words :
(a) The elf could sit on a twig because .......... eee .
(b) The elf loved .......... eee .
(c) The wizard hated ..................00. ,
(d) If the elf was not careful, the wizard would ................0008 ,
(e) As the elf’s song grew clear and strong ..............:e .
(f) The wizard-worm made a leap and ............ and was swallowed up ......... .

4. Discuss the following:
(a) Why the wizard can take only frightening and ugly shapes.
(b) Does the elf sing a happy song?
